channel.title: Array help, posted code

item.title: Array help, posted code
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

public void arrayTest() { int getRandomNumber = (int)(Math.random() * 5); String[] aStringArray = { "here", "is", "an", "array", "of", "words" }; for (String s : aStringArray) { if (aStringArray[getRandomNumber] != s) { continue; } System.out.println(aStringArray[getRandomNumber]); } } Like this? That will print a random word from the array.

Read full topic

item.title: Array help, posted code
item.dc:creator: @vividnemesis vividnemesis
item.description:
@vividnemesis wrote:

[quote=“Null Amount, post:4, topic:531360”][quote author=vividnemesis link=topic=650134.msg4365726#msg4365726 date=1379638272]

public void loopTest() { String[] test = { "this", "is", "the", "array", "test!" }; for (String s : test) { System.out.println(s); } }

what if i want to "Misc.random(3) it? so 3 randoms at a time? is that:

or what if i want to only use 3 of the words when i do something and the 2 others when i do something else?
[/quote]What do you mean 3 randoms at a time?[/quote]
like, make it pick 3 random “messages” and send only those random 3 instead of all 5

item.title: Array help, posted code
item.dc:creator: @vividnemesis vividnemesis
item.description:
@vividnemesis wrote:

hi guys i got this code, and etc, i wanna make it say all the words? played around with it a bit, and didnt find a solution
i really have no idea if anything of this is right :S

[code]public void test(Player p,String[] args){
String[] test = args;
char[] a = ‘hi’,‘babe’,‘how’,‘are’,‘you’;

for(char i = 0; i< test.length; i++){
if (i < 5){
	a[i] = Integer.parseInt(test[i]);
	}
}
for(char n: a){
	p.frames.sendMessage(p,"."+n);
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
